In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **at sign** (**@**) serves the following purposes:

- @ represents a [human or elf](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf"):

  - @ [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")
  - @ [archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)")
  - @ [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest")
  - @ [barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)")
  - @ [captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain")
  - @ [caveman](/wiki/Caveman_\(player_monster\) "Caveman (player monster)")
  - @ [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus")
  - @ [Dark One](/wiki/Dark_One "Dark One")
  - @ [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger")
  - @ [elf-lord](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord")
  - @ [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster\) "Elf (monster)")
  - @ [Elvenking](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking")
  - @ [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master")
  - @ [Green-elf](/wiki/Green-elf "Green-elf")
  - @ [Grey-elf](/wiki/Grey-elf "Grey-elf")
  - @ [guard](/wiki/Guard "Guard")
  - @ [healer](/wiki/Healer_\(player_monster\) "Healer (player monster)")
  - @ [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest")
  - @ [Hippocrates](/wiki/Hippocrates "Hippocrates")
  - @ [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster\) "Human (monster)")
  - @ [King Arthur](/wiki/King_Arthur "King Arthur")
  - @ [knight](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)")
  - @ [lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant")
  - @ [Lord Carnarvon](/wiki/Lord_Carnarvon "Lord Carnarvon")
  - @ [Lord Sato](/wiki/Lord_Sato "Lord Sato")
  - @ [Master Assassin](/wiki/Master_Assassin "Master Assassin")
  - @ [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen")
  - @ [Master of Thieves](/wiki/Master_of_Thieves "Master of Thieves")
  - @ [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")
  - @ [monk](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)")
  - @ [neanderthal](/wiki/Neanderthal "Neanderthal")
  - @ [Neferet the Green](/wiki/Neferet_the_Green "Neferet the Green")
  - @ [ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja")
  - @ [Norn](/wiki/Norn "Norn")
  - @ [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse")
  - @ [Oracle](/wiki/Oracle "Oracle")
  - @ [Orion](/wiki/Orion "Orion")
  - @ [Pelias](/wiki/Pelias "Pelias")
  - @ [priest](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)")
  - @ [prisoner](/wiki/Prisoner "Prisoner")
  - @ [ranger](/wiki/Ranger_\(player_monster\) "Ranger (player monster)")
  - @ [rogue](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)")
  - @ [samurai](/wiki/Samurai_\(player_monster\) "Samurai (player monster)")
  - @ [sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant")
  - @ [Shaman Karnov](/wiki/Shaman_Karnov "Shaman Karnov")
  - @ [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper")
  - @ [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier")
  - @ [Thoth Amon](/wiki/Thoth_Amon "Thoth Amon")
  - @ [tourist](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)")
  - @ [Twoflower](/wiki/Twoflower "Twoflower")
  - @ [valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)")
  - @ [watch captain](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain")
  - @ [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman")
  - @ [werejackal](/wiki/Werejackal "Werejackal") in human form
  - @ [wererat](/wiki/Wererat "Wererat") in human form
  - @ [werewolf](/wiki/Werewolf "Werewolf") in human form
  - @ [wizard](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)")
  - @ [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")
  - @ [Woodland-elf](/wiki/Woodland-elf "Woodland-elf")
    - [Defunct](/wiki/Defunct_features "Defunct features") and [deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred") monsters:
  - @ [Charon](/wiki/Charon "Charon")
  - [You](/wiki/You "You") appear as @ if the [showrace](/wiki/Showrace "Showrace") option is toggled off. If the option is toggled on, you appear as @ while playing as a [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") or [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), or you are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into one of the above monsters.

- Press [@]() to toggle [autopickup](/wiki/Autopickup "Autopickup") on or off.

- [In a menu](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls"), press [@]() to invert the current selection globally; this is supported by [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty") and [curses interfaces](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [2.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Historical uses

In Hack for PDP-11, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), with the exception of the player, shopkeepers and treasurers used the @ glyph. In [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), shopkeepers and guards use the @ glyph.

## Variants

Variants that add new roles will also add corresponding [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), as well as [quest guardians](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"), leaders and nemeses, that often use the @ glyph. Variants with [racial monsters](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") will have those monsters use a glyph that matches their race - humans, elves and other applicable races will appear as @.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") is a playable race, and several new monsters are introduced that use the @ glyph:

- @ / f [werepanther](/wiki/Werepanther "Werepanther")
- @ / f [weretiger](/wiki/Weretiger "Weretiger")
- @ / S [weresnake](/wiki/Weresnake "Weresnake")
- @ / s [werespider](/wiki/Werespider "Werespider")
- @ [gibberling](/wiki/Gibberling "Gibberling")
- @ [grimlock](/wiki/Grimlock "Grimlock")
- @ [High-elf](/wiki/High-elf "High-elf")
- @ [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster\) "Drow (monster)")
- @ [mugger](/wiki/Mugger "Mugger")
- @ [gypsy](/wiki/Gypsy "Gypsy")
- @ [black marketeer](/wiki/Black_marketeer_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black marketeer (SLASH'EM)")
- @ [flame mage](/wiki/Flame_mage_\(player_monster\) "Flame mage (player monster)")
- @ [ice mage](/wiki/Ice_mage_\(player_monster\) "Ice mage (player monster)")
- @ [necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer_\(player_monster\) "Necromancer (player monster)")
- @ [undead slayer](/wiki/Undead_slayer_\(player_monster\) "Undead slayer (player monster)")
- @ [yeoman](/wiki/Yeoman_\(player_monster\) "Yeoman (player monster)")
- @ [High Flame Mage](/wiki/High_Flame_Mage "High Flame Mage")
- @ [High Ice Mage](/wiki/High_Ice_Mage "High Ice Mage")
- @ [Dark Lord](/wiki/Dark_Lord "Dark Lord")
- @ [Van Helsing](/wiki/Van_Helsing "Van Helsing")
- @ [Chief Yeoman Warder](/wiki/Chief_Yeoman_Warder "Chief Yeoman Warder")
- @ [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage")
- @ [Earth Mage](/wiki/Earth_Mage "Earth Mage")
- @ [Colonel Blood](/wiki/Colonel_Blood "Colonel Blood")
- @ [igniter](/wiki/Igniter "Igniter")
- @ [froster](/wiki/Froster "Froster")
- @ [embalmer](/wiki/Embalmer "Embalmer")
- @ [exterminator](/wiki/Exterminator "Exterminator")
- @ [Yeoman Warder](/wiki/Yeoman_Warder "Yeoman Warder")

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), human and elven racial monsters use the @ glyph.

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces several new monsters that use the @ glyph:

- @ [mugger](/wiki/Mugger "Mugger")
- @ [black marketeer](/wiki/Black_marketeer_\(UnNetHack\) "Black marketeer (UnNetHack)")
- @ [Executioner](/wiki/Executioner "Executioner")
- @ [Robert the Lifer](/wiki/Robert_the_Lifer "Robert the Lifer")
- @ [Warden Arianna](/wiki/Warden_Arianna "Warden Arianna")
- @ [inmate](/wiki/Inmate "Inmate")
- @ [prison guard](/wiki/Prison_guard "Prison guard")
- @ [miner](/wiki/Miner "Miner")
- @ [convict](/wiki/Convict_\(player_monster\) "Convict (player monster)")

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") are split off into the [Quendi](/wiki/Quendi "Quendi") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), Q.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the drow is a playable race, and human, elven and drow racial monsters use the @ glyph.

EvilHack introduces several new monsters that use the @ glyph:

- @ [elven wizard](/wiki/Elven_wizard "Elven wizard")
- @ [The Rat King](/wiki/Rat_King_\(EvilHack\) "Rat King (EvilHack)")
- @ [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen")
- @ [Kathryn the Enchantress](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Enchantress "Kathryn the Enchantress")
- @ [drow](/index.php?title=Drow_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow raider](/index.php?title=Drow_raider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow raider (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow warrior](/index.php?title=Drow_warrior\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow warrior (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow mage](/index.php?title=Drow_mage\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow mage (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow cleric](/index.php?title=Drow_cleric\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow cleric (page does not exist)")
- @ [Charon](/wiki/Charon "Charon")
- @ [Robert the Lifer](/wiki/Robert_the_Lifer "Robert the Lifer")
- @ [Warden Arianna](/wiki/Warden_Arianna "Warden Arianna")
- @ [inmate](/wiki/Inmate "Inmate")
- @ [prison guard](/wiki/Prison_guard "Prison guard")
- @ [miner](/wiki/Miner "Miner")
- @ [convict](/wiki/Convict_\(player_monster\) "Convict (player monster)")
- @ [Archbishop of Moloch](/wiki/Archbishop_of_Moloch "Archbishop of Moloch")
- @ [Paladin](/wiki/Paladin_\(monster\) "Paladin (monster)")
- @ [cultist](/wiki/Cultist "Cultist")
- @ [agent](/wiki/Agent "Agent")
- @ [champion](/wiki/Champion_\(monster\) "Champion (monster)")
- @ [templar](/index.php?title=Templar\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Templar (page does not exist)")

Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the at sign (@) serves the following purposes:

  • @ represents a human or elf:
    • @ aligned priest
    • @ archeologist
    • @ Arch Priest
    • @ barbarian
    • @ captain
    • @ caveman
    • @ Croesus
    • @ Dark One
    • @ doppelganger
    • @ elf-lord
    • @ elf
    • @ Elvenking
    • @ Grand Master
    • @ Green-elf
    • @ Grey-elf
    • @ guard
    • @ healer
    • @ high priest
    • @ Hippocrates
    • @ human
    • @ King Arthur
    • @ knight
    • @ lieutenant
    • @ Lord Carnarvon
    • @ Lord Sato
    • @ Master Assassin
    • @ Master Kaen
    • @ Master of Thieves
    • @ Medusa
    • @ monk
    • @ neanderthal
    • @ Neferet the Green
    • @ ninja
    • @ Norn
    • @ nurse
    • @ Oracle
    • @ Orion
    • @ Pelias
    • @ priest
    • @ prisoner
    • @ ranger
    • @ rogue
    • @ samurai
    • @ sergeant
    • @ Shaman Karnov
    • @ shopkeeper
    • @ soldier
    • @ Thoth Amon
    • @ tourist
    • @ Twoflower
    • @ valkyrie
    • @ watch captain
    • @ watchman
    • @ werejackal in human form
    • @ wererat in human form
    • @ werewolf in human form
    • @ wizard
    • @ Wizard of Yendor
    • @ Woodland-elf
      • Defunct and deferred monsters:
    • @ Charon
    • You appear as @ if the showrace option is toggled off. If the option is toggled on, you appear as @ while playing as a human or elf, or you are polymorphed into one of the above monsters.
  • Press @ to toggle autopickup on or off.
  • In a menu, press @ to invert the current selection globally; this is supported by tty and curses interfaces.

Historical uses

In Hack for PDP-11, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, with the exception of the player, shopkeepers and treasurers used the @ glyph. In Hack 1.0, shopkeepers and guards use the @ glyph.

Variants

Variants that add new roles will also add corresponding player monsters, as well as quest guardians, leaders and nemeses, that often use the @ glyph. Variants with racial monsters will have those monsters use a glyph that matches their race - humans, elves and other applicable races will appear as @.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the drow is a playable race, and several new monsters are introduced that use the @ glyph:

  • @ / f werepanther
  • @ / f weretiger
  • @ / S weresnake
  • @ / s werespider
  • @ gibberling
  • @ grimlock

GruntHack

In GruntHack, human and elven racial monsters use the @ glyph.

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces several new monsters that use the @ glyph:

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the drow is a playable race, and human, elven and drow racial monsters use the @ glyph.

EvilHack introduces several new monsters that use the @ glyph:
